title: Encoding issue. recognizing tcp4 as tcp/Ӓ when net.Dail is called
body:
by **chbfiv**: 
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. make
2. ./server
3. 2010/02/19 22:52:37 unknown port tcp/Ӓ


What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
none, shouldn't have a problem.

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
linux 386

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
53fec18b83e2 release/release.2010-02-17


Please provide any additional information below.
tcp/Ӓ should be tcp4, seems like an encoding problem. I provided the files 
to compile the simple test project

uname -a
Linux XLINUX 2.6.31-19-generic-pae #56-Ubuntu SMP Thu Jan 28 02:29:51 UTC 
2010 i686 GNU/Linux
Attachments: 1. client.go (122 bytes) 1. server.go (1821 bytes) 1. Makefile (429 bytes)
